snippet: Changes to the N.F.L.’s kickoff rules appear to account for a slight decline in the number of concussions reported across the league last season, according to a consulting firm’s study of injury data.
abstract: Study on injury data provided by the NFL players' union shows changes to kickoff rules accounted for a slight decline in the number of concussions reported across the league last season.
lead_paragraph: Changes to the N.F.L.’s kickoff rules appear to account for a slight decline in the number of concussions reported across the league last season, according to a consulting firm’s study of injury data.
